item.title: Install Applications from App Store
item.description:
This section explains how to install applications from the App Store.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Application Instance Create permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Application Instance Create permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Application Workloads > Applications in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Create on the page.

  4. Click From App Store in the Create App dialog.

  5. In the App Store, click the application template you want to use, then click Deploy in the top right corner.

    Note

    If the Deployment Notice dialog appears, carefully read the relevant content, then click Agree.

item.title: Install Applications Using App Templates
item.description:
This section explains how to install applications from application templates in the workspace or third-party application repositories.

Note

To use application templates in the workspace, you need to install and enable the "App Store Management" extension. After installation, App Templates will display under the App Management menu in the workspace. Workspace members with relevant permissions can then create application templates for the workspace.

item.title: View Application List
item.description:
This section explains how to view the application list.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Application Instance View permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Application Instance View permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Application Workloads > Applications in the left navigation pane.

    • The application list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: View Details of Template-based Applications
item.description:
This section explains how to view details of template-based applications.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Application Instance View permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Application Instance View permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Application Workloads > Applications in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the Applications page, click the name of an application to open its details page.

  4. In the Attributes section on the left side of the details page, view the resource attributes of the application.

    Parameter Description

    Cluster

item.title: Edit Application Information
item.description:
This section explains how to edit application information.

You can edit the alias and description of an application. KubeSphere does not support editing the name of an already created application.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Application Instance Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Application Instance Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Application Workloads > Applications in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right of the application you want to edit, then choose Edit Information from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Edit Information dialog, set the alias and description for the application, then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Alias

item.title: Edit Application Settings
item.description:
This section explains how to edit the settings of a created application.

When creating an application, you can also edit its settings. For more information, see Install Applications from App Store and Install Applications Using App Templates.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Application Instance Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Application Instance Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Application Workloads > Applications in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the Applications page, click the name of an application to open its details page.

  4. On the top left corner of the application details page, select More > Edit Settings.

  5. In the Edit App Settings dialog, choose the target application version on the right, edit the application settings, and then click OK.

item.title: Delete Applications
item.description:
This section explains how to delete an application.

Prerequisites

You should join a project and have the Application Instance Deletion permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Delete a Single Application

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Application Instance Deletion permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Application Workloads > Applications in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click next to the application you want to delete, and select Delete from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Delete App dialog, enter the name of the application, and then click OK.
